{ return (
, , ]} bottomBlock={[ , ]} />, ]} /> , Context: Arrival Bank is a digital bank for global businesses and startups across the world. When Ijoined the company, the prior web app version had recently been launched. The CEOs were dissatisfied with the apps quality, and the CX team received alot ofnegative feedback from the users. } />, Primary challenge: clarifying and communicating the need foracomplete redesign. } />, The key issue was{' '} the absence of a UX strategy and vision. Thedesign process was flawed, often skipping the research phase. Asaresult, the design team lacked a solid understanding of users and their needs, and the usability of solutions was never assessed, leading to a poor user experience. } />, In this context, I took the initiative,{' '} proactively leading a comprehensive revamp project {' '} with a proper design thinking process and{' '} establishing a UX strategy for the product. } />, My role: 80% ofthe time Iwasthe solo designer. Inthe final month, asecond designer joinedtoaccelerate the development preparations under my supervision. } />, , Deliverables: Afull-scale application revamp, New visual style, New UIkit. } />, ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> ]} bottomBlock={[ , ]} /> ]} textElementType="h3" text="Stakeholders interviews " />, , ]} textElementType="p" text="Business goals (History, background, vision for the product, context)" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Current beliefs about users (Customer segments, feedback, research data)" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Gather their concerns about the current application" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Understand competitors and potential market challenges" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Constraints (Technical, financial, organizational) " />, ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> ]} textElementType="h3" text="Old app mind map " />, , ]} bottomBlock={[ , ]} /> ]} textElementType="h3" text="Heuristic evaluation" />, , , ]} text={ <> Illogical information architecture: The app structure was inconvenient atall levels. Dashboard, feature sections, entry points, aswell asthe organization ofblocks, cards, and their content, did not consider the real value ofthe provided information for the user. Some important features and screens were difficult tofind, and the information presented was not always clear. } />, , ]} text={ <> Unscalable structure: Adding new features caused challenges for the design and development teams, resulting ininefficient use ofresources. Asaresult, the final location offeatures was often illogical orhard tofind. } />, , ]} text={ <> High cognitive load: Regarding UXmany flows and scenarios were overloaded and unclear. } />, , ]} text={ <> Unsophisticated user interface: There were numerous inconsistencies, insufficient color contrast, and small, hard-to-read fonts. Overall, the design gave the impression ofadraft rather than afinished product. } />, ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> ]} textElementType="h3" text="User research" />, I initiated my research by conducting a{' '} competitive analysis to understand the approaches of the similar fintech applications. I also wanted to identify functional and usability gaps by exploring alternative solutions. } />, Then I partnered with a UX researcher to conduct extensive primary research. Discovery interviews provided valuable insights into our target users' pain points, preferences, and desired features. Lastly,{' '} usability testing helped identify specific issues within the current solution. } />, ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> , , ]} textElementType="h5" text="User type #1 needs global bank account" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Wants a single bank that could follow them across different countries, rather than using multiple solutions in each country." />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Thinks that sending international wires is tricky and expensive." />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Needs to be able to open multiple accounts with various currencies and needs an exchange mechanism." />, ]} textElementType="h5" text="User type #2 needs crypto friendly bank" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Rejected by banks due to restrictions" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="The ability to store crypto and make crypto to fiat transactions iscrucial" />, ]} textElementType="h5" text="User type #3 needs more convenient bank" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Wants digital online bank" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Needs fallback solution to reduce risks" />, ]} textElementType="p" text="Experienced frustrating log outs, disconnections from integrations, customer support issues" />, Other mutual pains{' '} &{' '} needs } />, , ]} /> What can we address now? Many pains, gains and user needs uncovered in the research couldn't be resolved through design alone due to various business and technical restrictions. } />, , , ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> ]} textElementType="h3" text="Ideation & Prototype " />, Defining the importance of flows and screens:{' '} For the sake of speed and efficiency, the redesign was planned to be carried out in 3 stages: } />, , , , Early design explorations: Prioritizing information hierarchy and app structure over UI details at this point is crucial for a well-structured interface. Wireframes allow rapid iteration due to their low-fidelity representation. They facilitate experimenting with layouts and concepts, gathering early feedback. } />, ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> Visual design establishment and UT prototype:{' '} After exploring various iterations ofideas, itwas time todesign final-looking visual layouts and prepare them for the usability test. } />, ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> , ]} textElementType="h3" text="New solution validation " />, , ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> ]} textElementType="h3" text="Polishing & Handoff " />, UI kit and style guide finalization: Iaimed for user feelings oftrust, control, and clarity inour app, while also striving for anunconventional, boundary-pushing interface that aligns with Arrivals brand. Ichose moderately soft forms, blueish backgrounds, fonts, and primary colors for asense ofcalm. Gradients and illustrations (byanother designer) were added for the desired 'abnormal' touch. } />, Dev handoff & Result testing: A series of meetings were conducted with the analytics and development teams to showcase the new solutions throughout the redesign process and upon completion. } />, After finalizing the designs, they were handed over to the analytics team to provide detailed development specifications. Subsequently, we conducted weekly calls with the development and analytics teams to address any questions that arose during the development phase. } />, Once the development of a specific feature was completed, thorough testing was conducted to ensure that the implementation aligned with the intended design. } />, ]} bottomBlock={[]} /> , , Successful launch: {' '} Ineight months Isuccessfully conceptualized, delivered and tested acomprehensive web application design along with web UI kit. } />, Valuable insights: Our extensive and meticulous research yielded crucial information about our customers, which not only educated the team about our users but also significantly influenced future solutions. } />, Improved information architecture and structure: {' '} The app's structure and architecture were entirely restructured and enhanced. The redesign resulted in a more scalable and efficient design, benefitting all sides users, design and development teams. } />, ]} bottomBlock={[ , ]} />, ]} />
) } export default ArivalWeb
